div3.head: John Wards Book of the 102 P V

div3.p: the Regt was payd of to day Oct the 18/62 up to the first of Sept Reced a letter from home Nove 4 th Reced a letter 14th Sent a letter 19th Recd a letter to day 27 Date of the 18 Sent a letter 27th Sent a letter 30 Dec 2 Recd a letter of Nov 21 Dec 4 Recd a letter Date Dec 7th Dec Sent a letter Date 9th Dec 17th Recd a letter Date 7 Dec sent a letter 1.9 Dec 20 Recd letter sent 13

Left camp this moringin at Six Oclock Near Clear Springs at the foot of the North Mountins In Washington Co Md a Rived at Hancock at 7 PM and in camp for the Night Oct 20th Sent $40 Dollars home to day by Admay Expres With Henry Lightle Post Master for the Regt Sent a letter
[word lined out]
Home to Day by Mail Whe leade in this Camp until the morning of the 21st Oct
Left camp near Hancock this moringin affter none at 4½ oclock and march a 11 miles to Indeman House on top of the North Mounten and camp 6 hours
Left camp and Went back to Slipe Creek 6 miles from Hancock Md north
- at the point of the [word lined out] Receved Orders to mouve at Daybreak t The ordered then countermanded and whe stade all Night Whe Captured 12 of Sturds Cav
firing was hard this morning at Chiney Creek 5 miles [-] the Regt Captured 21 of Sturds cavil[-] to Day and to the Provest Marched Receved 2 letters Frome home to Day

Whe in Camp Nere The Batle grawn of antedays
[word lined out]
return the mountains
The is verey Reney to Day it comince 3 A.M. Whe was still at mill Stone Point Money Mareyland Sent home the Rect For Nancy

left Camp at Mill Stone Point at 9 A.M. and march to Willimport a distons of 20 miles and Reued Camp at 4 P.M. then saw the Rebles Pickets on the other side of the river at Williamport on the 26th and Whe in Camp 2 miles from Williamport to Night With the hauld Divishon
Camp Near William port Md the Regt got Vere Close to Day

Camp Nere Williamport the Regt Was Inspected to Day By Col Rusall of the 7th Mass. Whe Recivd orders to march at 2 oclock and Whe march to Downintwon 4 miles and in Camp Col Rowley got to the Regt to Day
Whe stade in Camp to Day Received orders at 6 oclock to march at 4 A.M.

March at 4 oclock thes morning on for Bonsbroo Pass thau Bonsbro to one
                            mile on the other sidy of Bornvillie and camp for the Night there
 M
                                20{1}

at Camp Nere Boodien Md the firing cominske this mornegin at 8 oclock at Chalis Wown Va the trops was croeng the Potmac Revor all Night and amgneshan town
Pass over the Rever last Night into Via and Whe are Readey At a montes Notice To march With Thre Days Reshone in our averscake genl Mclallan moved is queaters over the Rever to Day into Viregna the Crased at 9 A.M. at Berlen on the Potomac Rever Genl [--] crossed to Day at 7 A.M. into via at Berlen across the Potomac Rever at 9 oclock the fringing is verey havey at this time 9 A.M.
Brought over Nov 2d /62 Sent a leter Home to Day the fight to Day was at Smikers Gap in the Blew mountins Whe Reccced orders March to morrow Morngn at
[number lined out]
8 oclock A.M.
"The Regt got New Clouse to Day."{3}

Left Camp at 8 Oclock for to Cros the Potomac Rever at Berlien On the Ponton Bridge into Vagana Whe went To lovitesville and Stops until the [-] Whent Pass and Whent thow Whiteland 2 miles
Genl Bunsides tuck Comand of the armey of the Potmac Nov the 8th/62 and Relived McCallan Sent a letter home to Day
there Was nathunk ocordere to Day

Left Compe at 7 oclock A.M. and Pass Chatlates Stshan to Wevervill and
                            camp for the Night Genl Burnside Was With us to Day
 "Whe march 15
                            miles to Day"{4}
Recd Orders To march at 7 Oclock to Wards Freadeckburgh march 12 miles and Camp for the Night Camp at Ceder crick
March at 6 am and march to With in 2 miles of Stafford C House And camp for 2 Day the camp 3 miles from the Rail Road crose auck quer creek to Day march 12 miles to Day
camp Nere 2 miles Stafford C House Stay in camp to Day
Camp Nere Staffard it Rean all Day and Night the Wether was verey Bad and disagrebl
At the same Camp The Rebles are Reported to be 6 miles from this Camp in foresee Whe are in camp 5 miles from Aquir Creek and 5 miles from the Potomac Rever
Remaine in Camp to day
Receved orders to march to Aquai Creek at the mouth of the Rever Pass thouth Stafford this mormging on Rever in camp at aquice crick to Night after a march of 10 miles
A C Day Queater master came To Headquaters and [-] in major Patterson of the Breadge house this was a fine Day
this a verey Nice morngin
Genl Burnerdiz Was at aquia Creik to Day

div3.head: Nov 27th tusrday
div3.p: the Present oft the Unigite States was at the Landing to day and left for Washington City this moning on the mial Boat Baltimore Genl Burnside and Lincon held a consulton on the mail Boat at the landing at aquice crick on the 26th Mrs Burnside Was Left for Washigton City to Day

div3.head: Nov 28th Friday

div3.p: this is a verey Nice Day for this time of the year Capt Mcgloring & Luts W Day came to the Regt to Day

div3.head: Nov 30th Sunday
div3.p: Recd orders to march to morrow to Foyen the Brdge tomorrow moring 2 miles from Stafford

div3.head: Dec 1st Monday
div3.p:
Left aquce crick Landing this Moring at 8 oclok around at camp 2 ½ mile from Stafford C House and in Camp there
march 10 miles to Day{6}

div3.head: Dec 2nd Thusday
div3.p: Camp 2 1/2 miles from Stafford C H Recd some New Closes to Day I had the plesher Of Reading the Presandants Massage to Night in camp Nere Stafford C. H.

div3.head: Dec 3rd Wensday
div3.p: Recd ordards to march tomoren morngn at Dalilite to Bell Planes

div3.head: Dec 4th turesday
div3.p: left camp at 8 oclock A M Col Kenkead comeand the Brigade

div3.head: Dec 4th tursday
div3.p:
Genl Rawley as Comond of a Disvishon of ten Regt of infinertar and 4 Regt of Caverley & 2 Batteres of artrelery and form the Rear gard of the armey of the Patomac on this march it is rumerd that Genl Burnside as Reseind and Genl Hooker as the comand of the armey of the Potomac Whe Whe left camp this moring at 8 oclock Col Kenkard Comand of the Bradge
Whe march to Potomac Creek and in Camp for the Night march 10 miles

Fireday Recd orders to and march at 6 oclock A M towards Freedeckbugh whe in camp below to Night Frecdekburgh Six miles and 3 miles from the Potomac Rever. Whe had a verey euerce Snow strom to Day and Night

div3.head: Dec 6th Satarday
div3.p: Whe Stade in Camp to Day

p.hi: Genl Rawley Commend a disveshon Of ten Regt of infanty and fore of Caveldry and 2 Battery and from the Rear Gard

div3.head: Sunday Dec 7th
div3.p: Still in camp and verey cold and fresene With Snow on the grown this Camp is 3 miles from Ball Polenus Landing on the Potomac Croek

div3.head: Monday Dec 8th
div3.p:
verey find Day sent my Pappers for my Discharge to Day
to the Bridge Docter{7}

div3.head: Tuesday Dec 9th
div3.p: Recd orders to march tomorow moringen 12 Oclock None and have not march yet

div3.head: Dec Wensday 10th
div3.p: and a verey find Day

March at 6 Oclock the furingin Comance this morng at 6 oclock at Freckburgh
[word lined out]
Armey Whe in camp with the [-] [-] 5 miles from Freedburgh to Night
at Wiete Glok Church the Army crose into Fredburgh to Night 30 000 the over 5 Pontons Bridge Whe Burnd the City hour 50 Bradge Went over the Rever to Frickburgh at 7 Oclock on the moringin of the 12th Genl Rowley get is comishen this armey nice Day

hoar Brigde Went over the Rever at 7 Oclock this mornigin ther as bing fahting all Day and the Rebeles are failing Back the Rebeles Sharp Shuters Was behind the Chimles and Genl Burnside orders to Burn the City this was a verey Nise Day
ther was from fiffty to sexty of our men keld and wonded Wile laing down the Pontune Bridges the was 25 man Whent into a Boat and 20 of the Same Was kill and the other five charge on the Rebs and [-] them throuth the town and got Back Safe the Fightin lested untll 7 oclock at Night ther was a grat dill of musket firing affer Dorek

the arttlery cormence this moning at 10 oclock and it strifeak the Batle became Genaral in 30 minets after the fireng began and affter one hore the fireng slaking as if Rebeles Was given way the firingen was terrffer for one hour Bouth of artlire and mustecket *the gun Boats in* the Rever assisted the Soud force in this *Days Batle* this is a verey Nise Day - the Sun Shine Butfill the Batle Was With left Greand Divrhon Gen Franklin the firingen is more
Reapitt at 11 ½ oclock at 12 the muscket firing was trifice on the Right and then on the left the Senter apering to not be in gastge at this time at 15 minets affter 12 the Batle apers to be Come Generel all long the lines the musket firng on the Right verey houve at 20 minets affter 12 the musket firing is the hardes on the left and is tricfice all along lines and apers to be verey Generel all aglong the lines on the left the Rebs apere to fall Back at 30 Minets the firrin apers to Slaken some
the musket firing is not so fast the artillery is verey trffic at 35. minets the Rebs apere to be given Back all a long ther lines the artilery slacken a litle at 40 minets the must of made a charge on the Right and left as musket firing became verey triffic on both Right and left this most triffic Batle that I have ever seine it is verey heveay on the left now and most trriffic on the Right and Senter it is offoull it now becomes offoull all a long the lines
for one hour the the musket seces for a short time it be came verey havey on the left and then on the Right the Rebs apeare to faull Back on the left it now apeare the Rebels are gevene Why all along the lines it apeares to be the be verey on the Senter and on the Right for a Short time but the Rebs must be given Back for the left apeare to a firene Dorscerce from Wher I am at 10 minets letter
it appears to be heaver on the left it now apeares to be haver on the Right the sentrally must be Driving the Rebs Back at 1 ½ oclock the battle Was triefick all along the lines at 2 ½ oclock I Was Sadsfide the Rebeles Was going Back the fireng Was father of all thought it was verey hard on the Right the left having Drove the Right of the Rebles at 4 am it aperd to be verey livey on the right the Rebs going Back fast at this time
it has bing verey hard for the last 4 hours both artilery and Infrantery. 4.15 minets the firing Slackens some and get father of at 10 minets affter the Infantry firing becomes verey trifick at a father Distanc of on the Right at 4:30 minets the firing on the Right sackens some at this time I chould not herea aney firing on the Left and it gating father of on the Right at 35 affter I here firing no the left along whay of the firing on the left was trifick
Just as at Sun Down it Seme to Slaken on the Right And Was verey hevist on the left at 50 the firing of artillery is verey have all aglong line the fightng Did not Stop untll 7 oclock ther was a good Dill of musket fighting affter Dark oure Bridge Was order under fier about 2 ½ Genl Jackson of Pittburgh Was Kill to Day and Genl Bayard the P V Recevers Sufferd verey much in this Days Batle at Freckburgh
it is Reported that Whe hav lost in thei Batle fiftane thousand man 15000 In kild and wonded and the Rebls lost by ther hone account fore thousand 4000 But it must have bing mare it Was Jackson that faught aganct Franklin on the left the 62 PV Col Blacks Regt lost 78 Killd and wonded and missingin Gen Burnside Reaport is in Killd 1152, and wonded about 9000 missing about 900 the have al bing Proulld
ther is in the Hospotle abut Six thousand Wonded at the Batle of Freckburgh Akorden to Gen Burnside Afushal Report our lost Will not be over ten thousand

div3.head: Dec 14th Sunday
div3.p: the fight comince this mornig at about 5 oclock on the left the was not verey reapped it aperes that the Rebs is goone Back the Rebls have not gone back the armeys hold the same ground to Day as yesterday the firig to Day Was nothing but [-] the fring seese this after none and the fighting dose not a amount to much to Day the Northan Littes verey Butfoull to Night for thre houres

div3.head: Dec 15th Monday
div3.p: The firing begune At 7 AM the army of the fall Back to the Side of the Rever on the Night of the 15th the was all over in in moring by day lite on the moring of the 16th Col Rowley take command of the Regt to Day and Genl Weatdan tuck Command of the Bredge and Releve Col Rowley

div3.head: Dec 16th tuesday
div3.p: this moning the armey Down the on this Side the Rever towards St Gorge Ch the Rebles shalling us as the Went Whe had a verey storm of Rien this morng for about thee hours

div3.head: Dec 17th wansday
div3.p: Whe left comp at White Oak chirch and went to the regt this moring Nears Falmouth
Recd orders to March this moring At 7 Oclock Whe moved this moring 10 miles Nerer to and within 2 Miles of Bell Poling and in camp

div3.head: Dec 19th Friday
div3.p: camp neres Ball Planes

div3.head: Dec 20th Satarday
div3.p: Whe Remane in camp to Day

div3.head: Dec 21st Sunday
div3.p: all quite along the lines this morengin

div3.head: Dec 22d Monday
div3.p: moringin Whe are Still in camp and a verey fine moringin
at the camp Camp this was a verey Beaffall Day the sun was verey warm and Plasant

div3.head: Dec 24 Wensday
div3.p: Still im Camp all right this moringin

div3.head: Dec 25th tursday Crushmas Day
Dec 26th Friday
div3.p: all right along the lines this moringin E R Brontus the present of the Santy Cemater of Alleghney Couty Arrived of Camp to Day and Same Was here to Day

div3.head: Dec 27 Satarday
div3.p: all quity along the Lines Recd my Descharge this affternon

div3.head: Dec 28th Sunday
div3.p:
I left the Regt this moringin got to aquiere crick Landng
this affternon left for Washigton City at [hour not discernable] colack G to Washigton City on the moringin of the 29 and Was Paid of on the 30th Day of December and left Washington City for home and got home on the Night of the 30th at 2 colack in the moringin I Red my Pay of Weagirs up to the time of my Discharge $72.85 but no
Bounty or Pansian Recd I was in seperes 16 month and 2 day Was Dis Charge at Camp nere Falmouth Via

div1.head: Note
div1.p: This diary is covered in black leather and measures 3" X 5 ¾". It appears to be written in pencil.

[Transcription Notes: As you see, spelling is a problem for this diarist. However, this may furnish a clue to his pronunciation. Every attempt has been made to transcribe this diary as close to the original as possible. Spelling and punctuation are reproduced as found. If a word cannot be discerned, a hyphen is inserted for each missing word. For example, [--] indicates two missing words. The diarist's spelling is inconsistent and quite poor. Sometimes, for clarification, the correct spelling is inserted in square brackets. If the author inserts words above the line, the symbol "^" is used with the inserted words bracketed. Thus, if 'in this case' is written above the line, it would appear as ^ 'in this case'. To make reading this diary easier, where punctuation and or capitalization have not been used by the author, three spaces are used to denote the end of one thought and the beginning of another.]
